snippet: The flow of refugees out of the country grew sharply after President Bashar al-Assad’s government started using airstrikes against towns and neighborhoods that support rebels.
abstract: United Nations reports that more than 100,000 Syrians fled their country in August, a sharp acceleration of the exodus prompted by 18 months of conflict; refugee flood coincides with a marked increase in bloodshed following a sustained air campaign by the Syrian government.
